content: stained stonewashed purse this printed yarn looked similar to grape juice stains on stonewash denim hence the name difficulty size 11 wide x 8 high x 3 deep gauge 15 stitches single_crochet x 16 row = 4 inches materials 220 yards medium/worsted weight yarn mc red heart super saver in blueberry pie was used in sample 105 yards medium/worsted weight yarn cc caron simply soft in country blue was used in sample us h hook 5 mm or size needed for gauge blunt tipped tapestry needle material of choice for lining 12 zipper will need to be shortened to 11 or closure of your choice purse straps abbreviations chain chain double_crochet double_crochet repeat repeat single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch bottom row 1 rs using mc chain 41 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and each chain across to end turn 40 single_crochet row 2 chain 1 single_crochet in each single_crochet across turn row 3 - 12 repeat row 2 fasten_off front & back make 2 row 1 rs using mc chain 42 single_crochet chain 2 4 double_crochet slanted shell made in 2nd chain from hook *skip next 3 chain single_crochet chain 2 4 double_crochet in next chain repeat from * across to within last 4 chain skip next 3 chain single_crochet in last chain turn 10 slanted shells row 2 chain 3 counts as double_crochet 2 double_crochet in first single_crochet half slanted shell made *skip next 4 double_crochet single_crochet chain 2 4 double_crochet in next chain-2 space repeat from * across to last chain-2 space single_crochet in last chain-2 space turn 9 slanted shells 1 half slanted shell row 3 chain 3 counts as double_crochet 2 double_crochet in first single_crochet half slanted shell made *skip next 4 double_crochet single_crochet chain 2 4 double_crochet in next chain-2 space repeat from * across to last double_crochet single_crochet in last double_crochet turn 9 slanted shells 1 half slanted shell row 4 15 repeat row 3 fasten_off side gusset make 2 row 1 rs using mc chain 14 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook and each chain across to end turn 12 double_crochet row 2 chain 3 counts as double_crochet double_crochet in 2nd double_crochet and each double_crochet across to end turn 12 double_crochet row 3 - 8 repeat row 2 row 9 chain 3 counts as double_crochet decrease 2nd and 3rd double_crochet double_crochet in each double_crochet across to last 3 double_crochet decrease next 2 double_crochet double_crochet in last double_crochet turn 10 double_crochet row 10 repeat row 9 8 double_crochet row 11 repeat row 9 6 double_crochet row 12 15 repeat row 2 fasten_off assembly with cc and rs of front facing you single_crochet front to side gussets 2 single_crochet per double_crochet 1 single_crochet per single_crochet and bottom starting in the top left corner of the front single_crochet in each single_crochet 2 single_crochet in each chain-2 space single_crochet in each double_crochet across top of front join to first single_crochet with a slip_stitch fasten_off repeat for back crochet over ends as much as possible weave in any
